thread.title: Devon MP calls for Theresa May to quit as Brexit deal meltdown continues

author: Rom Preston-Ellis
title: Devon MP calls for Theresa May to quit as Brexit deal meltdown continues
text:
Devon MP calls for Theresa May to quit as Brexit deal meltdown continues A string of senior MPs have quit ministerial positions on Thursday Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
A Devon MP has joined growing calls for Prime Minister Theresa May to resign as the fall out from her Brexit deal continues.
Brexiteer Anne Marie Morris said she believed the threshold of 48 Tory MPs required to trigger a no confidence motion in the Prime Minister had been reached.
She told Newsnight: "There is quite a lot of disquiet in the House now."
Ms Morris, who has submitted a letter to the 1922 Committee, admitted she did not know how many other colleagues had called for a no confidence vote.
But she believed that the 48 letters required had been reached "subject to individual members saying they can be released". Read More Brexit updates LIVE Reece-Mogg hands in letter of no confidence after Raab and McVey resign
Ms Morris added in a Tweet: "If the leaked information on the proposed Brexit deal is accurate, I cannot support it.
"A Northern Ireland solution which divides the UK and a non-regression clause to ensure the UK cannot out-compete the EU are completely unacceptable. The PM is not delivering the Brexit people voted for."
Jacob Rees-Mogg has also submitted a letter calling for a no-confidence vote in Mrs May, it has been confirmed. Anne Marie Morris (right) has called for Theresa May to resign
The move is expected to trigger a slews of Tory Eurosceptic backbenchers handing in the letters that could force a leadership contest en-masse.
The confirmation comes just hours after the arch-Brexiteer issued a chilling threat to the Prime Minister over her Brexit deal.
In the key moment of his blunt statement, which brought the raucous House Of Commons to an awed silence, Rees-Mogg said: "As what my Right Honourable Friend says and what my Right Honourable Friend does no longer match, should I not write to [Graham Brady]?" Read More Fact checking claims that Brexit is to blame for upheaval of three of Devon's biggest brands
Brady is the chair of the 1922 Committee which collects letters of 'No Confidence' from Tory party members. If 15% of the party submits letters - 48 members - May will be forced to step down as Tory leader and Prime Minister.
Writing for DevonLive.com this week , Ms Morris said that Brexit is an opportunity for "our country to control our laws and borders".
Last year, she had the whip removed after being recorded saying the Brexit deal is a “real n r in the woodpile”.
Ms Morris, who has been the MP for Newton Abbot since 2010, described the UK leaving the EU without a deal as a “real n r in the woodpile” at the launch of a report into the future for the UK’s financial sector after Brexit.
She later apologised for her comments and had the whip restored. Like us on Facebook
